japanese:
全員、ちゃんとついて来てるよな？
今度ははぐれたりするんじゃないぞ。
translation:
Is everyone following properly?
Don't get separated this time, okay?

japanese:
ずいぶんと自信ありそうな足取りですが、
何か根拠があるのですか？
translation:
You seem pretty confident,
but do you have anything to back that up?

japanese:
泉とか、水の湧いている場所は
地形から推測できるんだよ。
それほど大きい島じゃないし、おそらく――
translation:
You can ascertain where springs or water sources
are located from the surrounding terrain.
This island isn't that big, so most likely%p-2;――

japanese: お？　どうやら正解だったか。
translation: Oh? Looks like I had the right answer.

japanese:
あっ！　泉だ！
こんなところにあったんだぁ！
translation:
Ah! There's the spring!
We found it!

japanese: 本当にありましたね……。
translation: It was really here...

japanese: すごい、フータロー。
translation: Amazing, Futaro.

japanese:
さすがねっ！
こういうときは頼りになるわ。
translation:
As expected!
You can always rely on Fu-kun in times like this.

japanese: こういうときだけとか思ってるんだろ？
translation: You're thinking ONLY during times like this, right?

japanese:
そんなことないわよ！
フー君はいつだって頼りになるもの。
translation:
That's not true!
You're always reliable.

japanese: へいへい。
translation: Right, right.

japanese:
それで？　水晶を探すんなら手早く頼むぞ。
できれば日が暮れる前には別荘へ戻りたい。
らいはを１人で留守番させちまってるしな。
translation:
So, if we're looking for the crystals, let's hurry
and find them. Ideally, we should return to the villa
before the sun sets. Raiha is alone at home.

japanese:
三玖、一緒に探しましょ。
あと一花も来るのよ。
translation:
Miku, let's search together.
Ichika, you come too.

japanese: えっ？
translation: Huh?

japanese:
探しているうちに
三玖が森に迷い込んだりしないように、
あんたが見張ってなさい。
translation:
So that Miku won't get lost in the forest
while searching, you should keep an eye on her.

japanese:
……私じゃなくて二乃を見張って。
一花、お願いしていい？
translation:
...Not me, keep an eye on Nino instead.
Can I ask you to do it, Ichika?

japanese:
ふふっ！
うん、わかった。
ちゃんと２人とも見張っててあげるよ。
translation:
Heheh!
Okay, got it.
I'll keep an eye on both of you.

japanese:
よーし！
じゃあ、私も探そっと！
translation:
Alrighty!
I'll start looking too!

japanese:
（走って探しに行くもんじゃないだろ。
　まずは足下を見回してみればいいだろうに……）
translation:
(Don't just run off to search.
 First, look around your feet first...)

japanese: （ん？　なんか光ったか？）
translation: (Hm? What was that light?)

japanese:
あの、上杉君もどうでしょう？
せっかくここまで来たんです、
私たちもみんなと一緒に水晶を……。
translation:
Hey, Uesugi-kun, how about searching with us?
Since we're already here, we should all look
for crystals together...

japanese: すまん、もう見つけちまったわ。
translation: Sorry, I've already kinda found one.

japanese: ええっ！？
translation: HUHHH?!

japanese:
目の前に落ちてた。
こうもあっさり見つかるとはな。
無欲の勝利ってやつか。
translation:
There's one on the ground in front of me.
I didn't expect to find it so easily.
It's an empty victory.

japanese:
……まさか、とは思いますが、
見つけたのに見なかったことにするなんてことは
しませんよね？
translation:
...I would think that was impossible, but you wouldn't 
have pretended you didn't see it even though you 
had found it, right?

japanese:
まあ、取りあえずこれはらいはへの土産にする。
ほしがってたからな。
translation:
Well, for now, I'll bring this as a souvenir for Raiha.
She was wanting one.

japanese: そうですか……。
translation: Is that so...

japanese:
五月ー？　どうしたの？
一緒に水晶、探そうよ。
translation:
Itsukiii? What's wrong?
Let's look for crystals together.

japanese: あ、はい――
translation: Ah, okay%p-2;――

japanese:
あ、いえ！
私は探しに来たというわけではないので！
上杉君と見回りに来ただけですので！
translation:
Ah, no!
I didn't come here to search for anything!
I'm just here to patrol with Uesugi-kun!

japanese:
意地張ってないで、ほしいなら探してこい。
ここまできたんだし。
translation:
Don't be stubborn. If you want one, then go find it.
We've come this far, haven't we?

japanese:
そうですね。
では、少し探してきます。
translation:
You're right.
Then, I'll go search for a bit.

japanese:
（やっぱり五月も水晶が目当てだったってことか。
　あいつまでなんで……）
translation:
(As expected, Itsuki is also after the crystals.
 Even her, huh...?)

japanese:
（それに、いつもならもっと
　意固地になって言い返してくるのに、
　いやに素直に探しに行ったな）
translation:
(Also, she would usually argue more
 and not follow so obediently.
 Why did she go search in such earnest?)

japanese:
（い、いや、別に俺には関係ないだろ！
　自意識過剰だぞ！　自重しろ俺！）
translation:
(N-no, it's not like it has anything to do with me!
 I'm being self-conscious! Control yourself, Futaro!)

japanese: あったー！　水晶発見です！
translation: Heeere's ooone! I found a crystal!

japanese: なんだ、意外と早かったな。
translation: What? That was pretty fast.

japanese:
ううう……。
私には探しものの才能がないようです。
translation:
Oooohh...
It seems like I don't have any talent
for finding things.

japanese:
あれ？　ほら、そこ！
五月の目の前にあるじゃん！
translation:
Huh? Look, there!
It's right there in front of you!

japanese:
え、えええっ！？
ありました！　こんな近くにあったんですね！
translation:
EH, EHHHHH?!
It was here! It was really this close to me?!

japanese:
五月は目が悪いから、
うっかりスルーしちゃってたんじゃない？
translation:
Your eyesight is bad, Itsuki,
so didn't you just miss it?

japanese: 指摘してくれてありがとうございます、四葉。
translation: Thank you for pointing it out, Yotsuba.

japanese: 四葉は……その水晶はどうするのですか？
translation:
Yotsuba...
what are you going to do with your crystal?

japanese: ……え～と、まだ考えてなかったなぁ。
translation: ...Umm, I haven't really thought about it.

japanese:
こういうとき、五つ子ってのも大変だな。
姉妹で交換するにしても相手が多すぎだ。
translation:
At times like this, being quintuplets is tough too.
Even if you were to exchange them amongst sisters,
there are too many of you.

japanese:
そうなんですよね～。
どうしようか迷っちゃいますよ。
translation:
That's true, isn't it?
I'm not sure what to do, either.

japanese:
さすが、伝説になるだけあって
簡単に見つかる物じゃないみたいだね。
translation:
As expected,
being legendary means it's not easy to find.

japanese:
ちょっと待って！
三玖、そこで何か光ってる！
translation:
Wait a minute! 
Miku, something is shining over there!

japanese: ……あ！　あった！
translation: ...Ah! I see it!

japanese: はい、二乃。
translation: Here you go, Nino.

japanese: ありがと――
translation: Thank you%p-2;――

japanese: って、なんで私に渡してるのよ！？
translation: Wait, why are you handing it to me?!

japanese: だって二乃が先に見つけたから。
translation: Because you saw it first.

japanese: そうだけど……。
translation: That's true, but...

japanese:
はあ……
じゃ、あんたの分が見つかるまで一緒に探すわ。
それで貸し借りなしよ？
translation:
*sigh*
Well, I'll search with you until we find yours.
No borrowing or lending until then, okay?

japanese: ……あ！　あった！
translation: ...Ah! I found one!

japanese:
一花も見つけた？
よかったね。
translation:
You found one too, Ichika?
That's great.

japanese:
うん、ありがと。
あと見つけてないのは三玖か。
translation:
Yeah, thanks.
Only you haven't found one yet, Miku.

japanese: あんた、やっぱり不器用よね。
translation: You really are clueless, aren't you?

japanese: ……探し物に不器用って関係ある？
translation:
...Is being clueless
connected to the inability to find things?

japanese:
不器用って、要領が悪いって場合もあるのよ。
あんたの料理のやり方を見てるとわかるわ。
translation:
Well, sometimes being clueless
means you're not good at finding your way around.
I can tell by watching you cook.

japanese:
ねえ、三玖。
あの辺はもう探したの？
translation:
Hey, Miku.
Have you searched over there yet?

japanese:
ううん、そっちはまだ。
……見てみようかな。
translation:
No, not yet.
...Let's take a look.

japanese:
うん、そうしなよ。
一ヶ所を丁寧に探すのもいいけど、
他の場所を見たら、ひょっこり見つかるかもよ？
translation:
Yeah, let's. It's good to search thoroughly
in one place, but if we look in other places,
we might find them unexpectedly.

japanese:
それもそうね。
ほら、探してみましょ。
translation:
That's true.
Come on, let's look for some crystals.

japanese: うん……。
translation: Yeah...

japanese:
大丈夫だよ。
三玖の分も、きっと見つかるから。
translation:
It's alright.
I'm sure we'll find yours too, Miku.

japanese:
あっ……！
あった！　あったよ、水晶！
translation:
Ah...!
There! There's a crystal!

japanese:
なんだ、こんなにあっさり見つかるなんて。
確かに一花の言うとおりだったわね。
translation:
What, you found it so easily.
Ichika was right.

japanese: ありがと、一花。
translation: Thanks, Ichika.

japanese: どういたしまして。
translation: My pleasure.

japanese:
ね、お姉ちゃんの言うことは
聞いても損はないでしょ？
なにしろ、ちょっとだけ人生の先輩なんだから。
translation:
Hey, it doesn't hurt to listen
to your older sister's advice, you know? After all,
I'm a little more experienced in life than you.

japanese: 同じ日に生まれたくせに、なに言ってんのよ。
translation: What are you saying? We were born on the same day.

japanese:
じゃあ、あとはこれをフー君に渡すタイミングね。
受け取ってもらえるように、一番効果的な
シチュエーションを考えなきゃ。
translation:
Okay then, now I just need to find the right timing
to give this to Fu-kun. I have to think
of the most effective situation where he can receive it.

japanese: ……私、そこまで考えてなかった。
translation: ...I haven't thought that far ahead.

japanese:
ふふん。
なら、ここで差をつけさせてもらうわ。
translation:
Heheh.
Then, let me take the lead here.

japanese:
あはは。
どんなシチュエーションで
フータロー君を困らせる気なのかなー？
translation:
Ahaha.
I wonder what situation you have in mind
to make Futaro-kun uncomfortable.

japanese: （一花のやつ、自分で見つけた水晶を三玖に――）
translation: (Ichika is giving the crystal she found to Miku%p-2;――%p;)

japanese:
すみません！
私、ちょっと行ってきます。
translation:
Excuse me!
I'll be back in a bit.

japanese: （あいつ、もしかして……）
translation: (Is she, perhaps...)

japanese: ……うん、これでいいんだ。
translation: ...Yeah, this is perfect.

japanese: 一花、ちょっといい？
translation: Ichika, can I talk to you for a second?

japanese:
ん？　どうしたの四葉。
そっちはもう水晶見つけた？
translation:
Hm? What's up, Yotsuba?
Did you find your crystals already?

japanese:
うん、私も五月も見つけたよ。
それでね、やっぱりこれは一花にあげようと思って。
translation:
Yeah, I found mine and Itsuki's as well.
And, I'd still like to give this to you, Ichika.

japanese: えっ？
translation: Huh?

japanese:
はい、受け取って！
これからもよろしくね、お姉ちゃん！
translation:
Here, take it!
Take care, big sis!

japanese:
待って四葉。
もしかして、さっきの見てた？
だから……。
translation:
Wait, Yotsuba.
Were you watching earlier?
If so...

japanese: 私、一花のことも、ちゃんと応援してるから。
translation: I'm properly rooting for you too, Ichika.

japanese: 四葉……。
translation: Yotsuba...

japanese: ……やっぱりか。
translation: ...As expected.

japanese: 四葉、もしかして自分が見つけた水晶を一花に？
translation: Yotsuba, did you give the crystal you found to Ichika?

japanese:
あいつのことだ。
おそらく、そうだろうな。
translation:
It's likely.
That's something she'd do.

japanese: ……私の分を四葉に渡してきます。
translation: ...I will give Yotsuba mine.

japanese: お前もかよ……。
translation: You too, eh...

japanese:
いいんです。
そもそも、これは……こういうときのために
探したものですから。
translation:
It's okay.
After all, I was searching for the crystals...
for situations like this.

japanese:
（ああ、なるほど。
　こいつが妙に積極的だったのは、
　四葉のためだったわけか）
translation:
(Ah, I see.
 That's why she was strangely proactive.
 It was for Yotsuba's sake.)

japanese:
四葉には、この水晶が必要なんです。
私の……勝手な想いかもしれませんが。
translation:
Yotsuba needs this crystal.
It may be...my selfish desire, though.

japanese: お前らなりの事情があるってことか。
translation: So, you guys have your own circumstances.

japanese:
……あなたには教えられません。
ですので、ここで待っていてください。
translation:
...I can't tell you that.
So, please wait here.

japanese:
待て。
それを渡したところで、四葉は受け取らないぞ。
今度はお前の分がなくなっちまうからな。
translation:
Wait.
Even if you give it to her, Yotsuba won't accept it.
Then, you will lose your share.

japanese:
それは……では、どうすれば……。
このままだと本当に四葉だけが水晶を……。
translation:
Then...what should I do...
At this rate, Yotsuba will really be
the only one without a crystal...

japanese: ほら、持ってけ。
translation: Here, take it.

japanese:
えっ？
これは、上杉君が見つけた水晶ですよね？
translation:
Huh?
Isn't this the crystal that you found, Uesugi-kun?

japanese:
変な勘違いすんなよ？
お前が２個拾ったことにして、
四葉に片方を分けてやればいい。
translation:
Don't make weird assumptions.
Just say that you found two of them,
and give one to Yotsuba.

japanese: これで姉妹全員１個ずつだ。
translation: Now, each sister has one.

japanese: ですが……。
translation: But...

japanese:
らいはの土産にと思ってたが、
今の状況を見れば、らいはもきっとこうする。
translation:
I was thinking of it as a souvenir for Raiha,
but considering the situation,
Raiha would probably do the same.

japanese: ……ありがとうございます。
translation: ...Thank you so much.

japanese:
（まったく、どいつもこいつも……。
　五つ子ってのは本当にめんどくせーな）
translation:
(Geez, all of them are so...
 Quintuplets are reeaally troublesome.)

japanese: （ともかく、これで満足しただろ）
translation: (Anyway, I'm sure they're satisfied with this.)

japanese:
おい、お前ら！
目的のものは見つけたんだろ、帰るぞ！
translation:
Hey, you guys!
You found what you were looking for,
so let's go home!

japanese:
フー君は？
水晶、見つけたの？
translation:
What about you, Fu-kun?
Did you find a crystal?

japanese: いや、見つけてないが。
translation: Nah, I didn't.

japanese: じゃあ、もう少し探しましょうよ！
translation: Then let's search a little more!

japanese:
探さねぇよ。
というか、俺はそもそも
探しに来たわけじゃないと言っただろ。
translation:
I'm not searching anymore.
Besides, I didn't even come here to search
for crystals in the first place.

japanese:
ええー……。
せっかくここまで来たのに。
translation:
Wha...
Even though we came this far.

japanese: 五月？　どうしたの？
translation: Itsuki? What's wrong?

japanese: いえ、なんでもありません。
translation: No, it's nothing.
